subdialogue_text: Oh, your head's square on your shoulders, is it?

I thought that clamouring tin can was the last,
but here we go again.
What is it you want from this old stone-humped hag?

I've nothing for you, not a smithereen.
I just like to stand here, and take in the view.

behavior: #0Choose "No business in particular" to the query
subdialogue_text: Keep your marbles intact, love.

behavior: #0Choose "No business in particular" to the query
subdialogue_text: At least until I lose mine.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "No business in particular" to the query
subdialogue_text:
I've nothing for you, not a smithereen.
I just like to stand here, and take in the view.

behavior: #0Choose "I have business with you" to the query
subdialogue_text: Well, that came out of nowhere.

behavior: #0Choose "I have business with you" to the query
subdialogue_text:
You think an old stone-humped hag
would be brimming with goodies?

behavior: #0Choose "I have business with you" to the query
subdialogue_text: I've none of that, not a smithereen.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "I have business with you" to the query
subdialogue_text: Strange little lad, you are.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "I have business with you" to the query
subdialogue_text: Strange little lass, you are.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "I have business with you" to the query
subdialogue_text: What on earth do you see in me?

At the close of the Age of Fire,
all lands meet at the end of the earth.

Great kingdoms and anaemic townships will be one and the same.
The great tide of human enterprise, all for naught.
That's why I'm so taken by this grand sight.
This must be what it's like to be a god.
Oh, if you just can't stop yourself, at least hear this.
Far below, there's a deep, dark hole carved out of a tree.

...From time to time,
voices brim from the depths of the cavity even now.

Mutterings of the very demon that Prince Lorian spoke of,
I'm sure.
Horrible sounds, of an afflicted thing yet cursing men.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Inquire of the Ringed City" after talking with Lapp
subdialogue_text: Why, where did you hear that name, love?

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Inquire of the Ringed City" after talking with Lapp
subdialogue_text: Oh, it doesn't matter. I'll tell you what I know.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Inquire of the Ringed City" after talking with Lapp
subdialogue_text: The Ringed City is said to be at world's end.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Inquire of the Ringed City" after talking with Lapp
subdialogue_text: Past this heap of rubbish, as far as one can go.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Inquire of the Ringed City" after talking with Lapp
subdialogue_text: But you'd better think twice.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Inquire of the Ringed City" after talking with Lapp
subdialogue_text:
The forsaken Ringed City was walled off
by the gods to contain the pygmies.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Inquire of the Ringed City" after talking with Lapp
subdialogue_text: ...and the dark soul is better left well alone...

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after choosing "Inquire of the Ringed City"
subdialogue_text: You're not willing to reconsider, are you?

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after choosing "Inquire of the Ringed City"
subdialogue_text: Well, that's just fine. It's a rare thing, to have a true duty.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after choosing "Inquire of the Ringed City"
subdialogue_text: Don't go and take it for granted, I suppose.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after choosing "Inquire of the Ringed City"
subdialogue_text: Won't do any better than this, not you or that poor tin can.
Keep your marbles intact, love.
At least until I lose mine.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Leave",  after choosing "Inquire of the Ringed City"
subdialogue_text: Don't run off and die, love.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Leave",  after choosing "Inquire of the Ringed City"
subdialogue_text: It's a nicer view with you in it.
My time has come, has it?
Well, maybe I'll get to see an angel.
##Ahh, yes, it's just what you'd guess.
##Legend says that the Ringed City lies at the end of the earth.
##This heap of everything, you're looking right at it.
##But be warned.

##The pygmies were exiled to the Ringed City.
And no one should go near the dark soul.
##When you see that tin can, pass the word along.
##I'm afraid he's a little too brave for his own good.
